scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You expressed understanding of Monica's concerns and acknowledged you should have set clearer boundaries. Bob commented that worrying about setting boundaries is over the top, and you agreed with him, noting that sometimes sacrifices are necessary for the team. [Monica] looks at you with a mix of disbelief and concern. You took a more assertive stance, questioning if the team can handle extra tasks. [Monica] looks visibly frustrated, while [Bob] raises an eyebrow.
scenes.description: [Monica] crosses her arms, 'So, [Alex], are you saying we should just accept any and all extra work thrown our way without question?'

options.text: Not exactly, Monica. I think we need to assess each situation individually.
options.analysis: You provide a balanced response, showing good emotional perception and self-regulation.

options.text: Maybe we do need to be more flexible and open to taking on extra tasks.
options.analysis: You lean towards agreeing with taking on extra tasks, showing strong motivation but lower social skills.

options.text: If we question everything, nothing will get done efficiently.
options.analysis: You take a more assertive stance, showing strong motivation but lower empathy and social skills.
